message.content:
cs.MOB, cs.DC, cs.OS, cs.AR, cs.SE 

The paper discusses smartphone augmentation approaches for resource-intensive application execution, which falls under the category of mobile computing. Therefore, cs.MOB is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses cloud computing as a major technology for augmenting computing capabilities of smartphones, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses software augmentation methods, which falls under the category of operating systems (cs.OS). The paper also briefly mentions augmented reality (cs.AR) as a potential application area for smartphone augmentation. Finally, the paper discusses the need for task offloading, which is a software engineering technique (cs.SE) for conserving local resources.
